properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Telephone Service Alert
properties.Summary:
Description: The City of Airdrie is experiencing an outage that is impacting the ability of TELUS MOBILE CUSTOMERS to contact 9-1-1. ### The City of Airdrie is experiencing an outage that is impacting the ability of TELUS MOBILE CUSTOMERS to contact 9-1-1. Telus cellular customers will not be able to dial 9-1-1 form anywhere in Alberta at this time. This outage DOES NOT impact landlines. Landlines can still be used to call 9-1-1 in an emergency.This outage is only impacting TELUS MOBILITY customers. It does not impact other providers. Telus is working to resolve this issue as quickly as possible.
Expires: 2020-04-01T10:20:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: City of Airdrie, 2020-03-25T10:18:45-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6268
Area: Airdrie
properties.Author: City of Airdrie

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected tonight into Wednesday. Snow will begin early this evening and will be accompanied by strong northeasterly winds of 50 gusting to 70 km/h producing whiteouts at times. The snow will taper off early Wednesday morning but the strong winds will continue and may generate blowing snow through the morning hours. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-25T18:24:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-25T02:55:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3778083905.2020
Area: Fort Severn
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Telephone Service Alert - Limited Access To 9-1-1
properties.Summary:
Description: Telus has informed The City of Red Deer of an outage that is impacting the ability of TELUS MOBILE CUSTOMERS to contact 9-1-1. If you require emergency assistance from police, fire, or ambulance, use a landline or head to your nearest emergency services station, fire station, or RCMP detachment ### Telus has informed The City of Red Deer of an outage that is impacting the ability of TELUS MOBILE CUSTOMERS to contact 9-1-1. This outage is impacting TELUS MOBILITY CUSTOMERS across the province. These customers will not be able to dial 9-1-1 form anywhere in Alberta at this time. If you require emergency assistance from police, fire, or ambulance, use a landline or head to your nearest emergency services station, fire station, or RCMP detachment. This outage DOES NOT impact landlines. Landlines can still be used to call 9-1-1 in an emergency. This outage is only impacting TELUS MOBILITY customers. It does not impact other providers. Telus is working to resolve this issue as quickly as possible.
Expires: 2020-04-01T09:32:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: City of Red Deer, 2020-03-25T09:31:40-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6267
Area: Red Deer
properties.Author: City of Red Deer

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 30 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northerly 70 km/h except 90 along parts of the coast. Locations: Clarenville, Terra Nova, and Bonavista Peninsula. Time span: continuing until late this afternoon. Remarks: Snow and strengthening northerly winds will combine to cause poor visibilities in blowing snow for much of today. Conditions are expected to improve late this afternoon. ### Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-26T05:18:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-25T13:19:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4289909333.2020
Area: Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Strong winds gusting to 70 km/h and fresh snow are reducing visibility in the region. Conditions are expected to improve early this morning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-25T17:59:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-25T10:19:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2001388086.2020
Area: Tuktoyaktuk - East Channel Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Telephone Service Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: Telus has informed Clearwater County of an outage that is impacting the ability of TELUS MOBILE CUSTOMERS to contact 9-1-1. This outage is impacting TELUS MOBILITY CUSTOMERS across the province. These customers will not be able to dial 9-1-1 form anywhere in Alberta at this time. If you require emergency assistance from police, fire, or ambulance, use a landline or alternate cellular carrier. ### This outage DOES NOT impact landlines. Landlines can still be used to call 9-1-1 in an emergency. This outage is only impacting TELUS MOBILITY customers. It does not impact other providers. Telus is working to resolve this issue as quickly as possible.
Expires: 2020-04-01T11:26:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Clearwater County, 2020-03-25T11:23:51-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6271
Area: Clearwater County
properties.Author: Clearwater County

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Telephone Service Alert Cancelled
properties.Summary:

Expires: 2020-03-25T11:51:32-06:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A wintery mix is expected for Thursday into Friday. Total snowfall: 5 to 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northeasterly 60 km/h. Locations: central to eastern Nova Scotia. Time span: Thursday afternoon until Friday afternoon. Remarks: Precipitation is expected to begin as snow Thursday afternoon then transition to a mix of ice pellets or freezing rain in the evening and overnight. Freezing rain may persist over Cape Breton into Friday morning before a changeover to rain showers or flurries. Precipitation will taper off Friday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-26T05:55:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-25T13:56:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0309106136.2020
Area: Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter storm ending this afternoon. Snow, heavy at times, will taper off this afternoon. Total snowfall accumulations near 25 cm are likely by this afternoon. Brisk north or northeast winds gusting to 50 or 60 km/h will also produce blowing snow, particularly over exposed areas. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-25T21:59:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-25T15:06:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3527077047.2020
Area: Peawanuck
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall tonight into Thursday. Snow, heavy at times, will begin late this evening and end early Thursday afternoon. The heaviest snow is likely early Thursday morning with total snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm possible. Travel may become difficult due to quickly accumulating snow. Motorists are advised to allow extra time to reach their destination. There is still some uncertainty with the track of the low pressure system responsible for this snow. Environment Canada meteorologists will continue to monitor this situation closely. A snowfall warning may be required. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-26T07:46:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-25T15:47:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3601783637.2020
Area: Kirkland Lake - Englehart, Temiskaming Shores - Temagami
properties.Author: Environment Canada
